intro: Sidalcea hickmanii subsp. pillsburiensis, commonly known as Hickman's catchfly, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States. It is characterized by its delicate pink to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, often in arid regions of California. It has small, hairy stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
